column5: Does not surprise me one bit! I only shared a couple of PM's with Ron a while back and he showed me some of his beautiful truck restorations. A talented man indeed!
goes around comes around, the hard work is done now, just working hard for the easy part is ahead , family and moments created by skipper  good on you sir  well done
great post.
Top notch there Skipper.
i'll agree with the habs fan.. this time.
Skipper is  a man of many talents !  He took this    and turned it into this, for me.    An 8"X12" ice hut trailer.
Well somehow I missed this thread when first posted, but let me add a big TWO THUMBS UP to Skipper. He sounds like the kind of guy that I'd like to spend a day or two with for sure.

Well many of you may or may not be aware, I purchased lake front property a couple of years ago, so ive been hurting to do some work on it but finances have been tight, since lakefront property aint exactly cheap! Thus, it was just a pipe dream, cue Ron Depatie code name Skip... He reached out to me via pm and said sometimes you shouldn't let money separate you from your goals. He said he would help me clear what would later be a 12'x300' driveway and a pretty damn big building site level and the works for a dollar amount a poor young dummy such as myself could afford! Let me be the first to say they dont make them like him anymore, putting a young families dreams before personal gain... Ron thanks Buddy!  Anyways did i mention this guy uses an excavator better then i use my left hand, and i'm friggin left handed!  To keep in budget he camped out in his camper which was roughing it to say the least. he even fed him self via the assorted gamefish my lake has to offer. In 3, 12 hour plus days he transformed my bush lot into a recreational dream with a stunning sand shoreline with granite breakwall all harvested from the property including something he did for my kids which was a 15' sand, rock free entry point to the water... If that wasn't enough for my  miniscule investment he moved at least a half dozen evergreen trees to provide shelter from the neighbors across the bay. Even though he went well beyond what was required of him for the dollar amount I paid he never complained anytime i requested a change or additional work... Once again what a guy!  and now for the pics....  the beginning of the madness...          Skip working the Excavator  Bro after a long day......    Rons piece de resistance a lil entry for the kidies...    sandy beachfront    Ron perfecting the shoreline....    view from the future building site...      we have about a lifetime supply of fire wood...   I strongly suggest you google Ron or just pm Skipper D...  Once again Ron im indepted to you for what you've done buddy we will be in touch again real soon..  Jason out.....
where is the "really like" button?
Seriously... that is awesome!  Hats off to the Skip!

Seriously... that is awesome!  Hats off to the Skip!  Friggin eh buddy, Friggin eh!!!! He's the man! lot of the "elder" members of this fine Board are cut out of the same mold as this guy, it seems like the generations that followed not all but quite a few especially the youth of today put their own needs ahead of everyone else. Thankfully there's still a lot of the good ones left... The work he does is of ridiculous quality and he is meticulous, at a more then fair price what more can you ask for?

Wow!  Thats awesome!!! Just wait till ya finish the property, envite him up for some fishing a few drinks. Thatll be some great times and great stories!  Skip, your a shining example of a great human being
This is a true "feel good" story ,  job well done
Your a good man Skip, that's a job well done !!  Good looking piece of property Jason and something you and your family will enjoy for many years to come.

When my boat house got destroyed this summer Ron was one of the first to contact me and offered to bring his equipment over here to help me out. I have had the pleasure of meeting him a few times now and it is always a pleasure!  Good job there Skipper!
I've had the chance to actually work with Skip, along with fishing, boat hunting (for him) and just hanging out.  Finestkind is all I gotta say!  Michael

Yup....That sounds like the Ron I know. He is a gem alright. Ron and I have shared many moments ove the past couple of years. Some sad, some really funny. He is a generous, and sincere gentle man.  Good on ya Skipper !!!

I've never met the man, but he seems to be a great guy. Not many left out there who will help people achieve their dreams for the right reasons. Keep up the good work skipper!  Enjoy the property. The kids will have memories that will last a lifetime.
Definitely above and beyond, hats off to you Skip.
Awesome work...awesome friends...awesome story!
I spent one day on the water with him and this doesn't surprise me at all. (Except maybe feeding himself by catching fish   . Those perch were pretty small Skip!)
Ron way to go!!!!It will come back to you.Good Karma .Hey,don't we still have a fish together ? Hoping to make that possible one day.Sooon!

WoW ! all this from a private pm I sent some two years ago . It’s too much but I will say I owe a big “Thank you” to Jason for bragging me up here and the same to every one else who post on Jason’s thread . O’ ps. I’d also like to say, he dose have one hex of a nice spot on the lake up there and if I were you guys I’d start suck’n up .... lol
O’ ps. I’d also like to say, he dose have one hex of a nice spot on the lake up there and if I were you guys I’d start suck’n up .... lol  HA! Good on ya Ron.
Its nice to see a refreshing post that is full of good vibes! Cheers to the lot of ya. Now if I can find someone to help me build a cottage on a tight budget ill be all set, lol.....
Way to go Skipper.

This is a great thread and one that does not shock me as there are amazing people here in the OFC family.  Congrats Ron for taking care of the young guys that will make his family many memories for the lifetime to come.
Always humble. You're a good man Ron.
Good to know that kind of person still exists! Good on ya Skip! much good karma im sure

I'll double click the like button as well. Hopefully many can learn from this giving and humble human being.  What a beautiful spot for your family and yourself. The harder you work the luckier you will get in life.  Now it's pay it forward time for you.
Good on ya Skip!!    :clapping:
like
